name: Dark Gyarados

abilities.name: Final Beam
abilities.text: When Dark Gyarados is Knocked Out by an attack, flip a coin. If heads, this power does 20 damage for each Water Energy attached to Dark Gyarados to the Pokémon that Knocked Out Dark Gyarados. Apply Weakness and Resistance. This power doesn't work if Dark Gyarados is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Normally found only in the deep ocean, it has recently been seen in shallow waters as well.

strengths: Final Beam can deal massive revenge damage when knocked out
Ice Beam has potential to Paralyze
Only Stage 1 - easier to set up than Gyarados
weaknesses: Final Beam is coin flip dependent
Ice Beam's Paralysis is also coin flip
Grass weakness is problematic vs Scyther
synergies: Defender (survive to maximize Final Beam energy)

competitiveHistory: Dark Gyarados was an interesting card that punished opponents for knocking it out. With multiple Water Energy attached, Final Beam could deal significant revenge damage - potentially knocking out the attacker. However, the coin flip requirement and status condition restrictions made it unreliable. Ice Beam's potential Paralysis gave it some stall capability.

rulings.ruling: Final Beam only triggers when knocked out by an attack, not by damage from Pokemon Powers or other effects.
Final Beam's damage is calculated before Dark Gyarados leaves play, using the Water Energy attached at that moment.
If Dark Gyarados is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed when knocked out, Final Beam doesn't trigger.
Final Beam applies Weakness and Resistance of the Pokemon that knocked out Dark Gyarados.
